a.title: Managing Stress and Anxiety During Difficult Times

div.a: Managing Stress and Anxiety During Difficult Times

nav.div: Oak Grove R-VI » District Information » OGR6 Plan of Action: Coronavirus (COVID 19)

p.style: line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 10pt; margin-bottom: 0pt; padding: 0pt 0pt 10pt;

span.style: font-size: 11pt; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(34, 34, 34);

p.style: line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt; padding: 0pt 0pt 10pt;

span.style: font-size: 11pt; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(34, 34, 34);

p.span: April 10th marks the end of the 3rd quarter. Students should be in contact with their classroom teachers concerning any assignments that have not been submitted. All required assignments were assigned before our last day of school, which was March 6th, 2020. All work since March 6th has been review and enrichment to keep students engaged in learning.

p.style: line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt; padding: 0pt 0pt 10pt;

span.style: font-size: 11pt; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(34, 34, 34);

p.span: Oak Grove R-VI will honor the orders of Governor Parson to remain closed the remainder of the spring semester and educate students remotely. The district’s number one goal has always been to support our families and consider the hardships and difficulties that come with remote learning. All students are encouraged to complete the weekly activities provided by their teachers. These activities will benefit students through engagement and preparing them for the next grade level. Students that were on track, prior to school closing, will be promoted to the next grade level for the 2020-2021 school year. Students that were not on pace for promotion, will be contacted individually by administrators. 4th quarter/2nd Semester grades will be determined differently for each building. Please refer to the information below from your building principal with more specific details.

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(34, 34, 34);
background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(34, 34, 34);

li.span: High School and Middle School will send out 3rd quarter grades early next week.

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(34, 34, 34);

li.span: Primary and Elementary Schools will not give 3rd quarter grades but teachers will add comments on student reports. See below for semester grades.

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt; white-space: pre; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(34, 34, 34);

li.span: Weekly student packets/activities will still be utilized through Friday, May 22nd.

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt; white-space: pre; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(34, 34, 34);
background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt; white-space: pre; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(34, 34, 34);

li.span: May 22nd will be the end of the 4th quarter/2nd semester.

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt; white-space: pre; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(34, 34, 34);

li.span: The next ECC/Primary and Elementary packet pick up will be Monday, April 27th from 3-6pm in front of Central Office.

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt; white-space: pre; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(34, 34, 34);

li.span: We will schedule a day in May for students to come to their buildings to collect all belongings.

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(34, 34, 34);

li.span: Summer school information will be released at a future date

p.style: line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 10pt; margin-bottom: 0pt; padding: 0pt 0pt 10pt;

span.style: font-size: 11pt; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(34, 34, 34);

p.style: line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt; padding: 0pt 0pt 10pt;

span.style: font-size: 11pt; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; text-decoration-line: underline; text-decoration-skip-ink: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(34, 34, 34);

font-size: 11pt; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(34, 34, 34);

p.span: : Students’ 3rd quarter grades will count as their semester grades. Students may raise their semester grades by completing the lessons teachers are providing. Students must also keep in mind that the essential standards are necessary for progression to the next course level (eg. English 2 to English 3 or Acting to Directing). All requirements must be met by the students in order to receive high school credit. Senior requirements will be extended to Friday, May 15, in order for seniors to meet graduation requirements. Students who failed 3rd quarter will need to complete the lessons teachers are providing for an opportunity to receive a passing grade for 2nd semester. Students with failing grades at the end of 2nd semester will need to attend online summer school and complete the required work to receive school credit. Students must understand that credits affect both MSHSAA eligibility for activities and sports and graduation.

p.style: line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt; padding: 0pt 0pt 10pt;

span.style: font-size: 11pt; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; text-decoration-line: underline; text-decoration-skip-ink: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(34, 34, 34);

font-size: 11pt; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(34, 34, 34);

p.span: : Student’s 3rd quarter grade will be their semester grade if the student/parent chooses. Students may raise their semester grade up to 1 full letter grade by completing the remote learning options provided in that class. Students currently with a failing grade will need to complete the remote learning options for an opportunity to receive a passing grade for semester. Students with failing grades at the end of the semester, may need to attend online summer school to receive school credit.

p.style: line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 10pt;

span.style: font-size: 11pt; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; text-decoration-line: underline; text-decoration-skip-ink: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(34, 34, 34);

font-size: 11pt; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(34, 34, 34);

p.span: : The end of 2nd semester will continue to be May 22. Parents will be emailed their student’s final report card at that time. Teachers will not report progress on individual grade level objectives, however they will summarize the student’s academic and behavioral strengths and weaknesses. Tom Huffington

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;

span.style: font-size: 11pt; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial;

span.br:
4-9-2020 Update:
OG Students, Parents, and Staff,

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;
p.span: It was announced today that all Missouri school will be closed for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year. This will bring about a large number of questions regarding many events and ceremonies that are held in the Spring. We will continue to provide educational resources for all our students and will continue to update everyone as information comes out. As we have done during this unprecedented situation, we will continue to adjust, develop, and revise as needed. We will strive to communicate as often as we can to keep everyone informed. Thanks again for your patience, understanding, and support during this challenging time.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;
color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;

em.span: JEFFERSON CITY, Mo. — Gov. Mike Parson has ordered all Missouri schools to close for the rest of the school year.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;

em.span: Classes for all public and charter schools will continue remotely for the rest of the school year, Parson said.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;

em.span: Missouri schools had already been closed through April 24 under the statewide stay-at-home order that Parson implemented late last week.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;

em.span: On Thursday, the governor said he made the decision to extend school closures with input from the Missouri Department of Elementary and Secondary Education and several rural and urban district superintendents.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;

em.span: There will be exceptions for nutrition and child care services, which were outlined when Parson previously ordered schools to temporarily close.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;

em.span: “Although it may be hard to see now, I want Missourians to know that our aggressive efforts to combat COVID-19 are working,” the governor said. “We were planning for COVID-19 long before Missouri’s first case and have been taking action ever since.”

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; letter-spacing: normal;
p.span: Below are some additional resources: Useful Websites About the Infectious Diseases and the Coronavirus from CDC:

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; letter-spacing: normal;
p.span: www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/index.html You might want to start here because this provides many more entries on CDC
